adjectives.description: amnestied (comparative more amnestied, superlative most amnestied)

entries.meaning: That has been given amnesty; whose past offences have been forgiven.
examples: The opening of the Panthéon Club in November 1795, a successor to the closed Jacobins, marked the beginnings of a recovery of the extra-parliamentary Left, now reinforced by amnestied militants.

entries.meaning: simple past tense and past participle of amnesty
